name:
WARNING: please check you have started this container with a volume that is mounted to /data
 otherwise any flow changes are lost when you redeploy or upgrade the container
 (e.g. upgrade to a more recent node-red docker image).
  If you are using named volumes you can ignore this warning.
 Double click or see info side panel to learn how to start Node-RED in Docker to save your work
info:
To start docker with a bind mount volume (-v option), for example:

```
docker run -it -p 1880:1880 -v /home/user/node_red_data:/data --name mynodered nodered/node-red
```

where `/home/user/node_red_data` is a directory on your host machine where you want to store your flows.

If you do not do this then you can experiment and redploy flows, but if you restart or upgrade the container the flows will be disconnected and lost. 

They will still exist in a hidden data volume, which can be recovered using standard docker techniques, but that is much more complex than just starting with a named volume as described above.

name: timeConvert
func:
let myDate = new Date()
myDate.setDate(myDate.getDate()-1);
myDate = myDate.toISOString().split('T')[0]
msg.myDate = 'AssetIngestionReport-Prod-'+myDate +".csv"
msg.url = 'https://api-bell.cadenttech.tv/api/v1/cis/ingestreport/?filter=custom&startdate='+myDate+'&enddate='+myDate+'&reportname=BellMediaReport&download=true'
msg.tittle = 'Cadent Asset Ingest Report Prod '+ myDate
msg.description = 'Hi, 

Attached is the production ad ingestion report.
For support contact: vt-tvaddressable@bell.ca

Thanks, 
Node-RED Bot


'
msg.from = 'vt-tvaddressable@bell.ca'
return msg;

name: toBase64
Format the header and payload
func:
msg.headers = {
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data; boundary=------------------------d74496d66958873e"
}


msg.payload = '--------------------------d74496d66958873e\r\n'+
'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="select"\r\n'+
'\r\n'+
'true\r\n'+
'--------------------------d74496d66958873e\r\n'+
'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="print"\r\n'+
'\r\n'+
'true\r\n'+
'--------------------------d74496d66958873e\r\n'+
'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="'+msg.filename+'"\r\n'+
'Content-Type: application/octet-stream\r\n'+
'\r\n'+
msg.payload+'\r\n'+
'--------------------------d74496d66958873e--\r\n';


return msg;

$boolean(arg)
func:
// $boolean(arg)

/*
Argument type	    Result
Boolean	            unchanged
string: empty	    false
string: non-empty	true
number: 0	        false
number: non-zero	true
null	            false
array: empty	    false
array: any true	    true
array: all false	false
object: empty	    false
object: non-empty	true
function	        false
*/

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Casts the argument to a Boolean
const expression = [
    jsonata("$boolean(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;

name: $not(arg)
func:
// $not(arg)

/*
Argument type	    Result
Boolean	            opposite
string: empty	    true
string: non-empty	false
number: 0	        true
number: non-zero	false
null	            true
array: empty	    true
array: any true	    false
array: all false	true
object: empty	    true
object: non-empty	false
function	        true
*/

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Returns Boolean NOT on the argument, the revese of $boolean()
const expression = [
    jsonata("$not(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;

name: $exists(arg)
func:
// $exists(arg)

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Returns Boolean, true if the arg expression evaluates to a value
// or false if the expression does not match anything
const expression = [
    jsonata("$exists(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;

$reduce(arr, fun, ini)
$keys(obj)
$lookup(obj, key)
$spread(obj)

$each(obj, fun)
$error(mes)
$assert(con, mes)
This flow requires the npm module jsonata
info:
run 'npm i jsonata' from your .node-red directory
and set functionExternalModules to true in your settings.js file
